page.title: 11MILTON IN THE 1900'S
page.content: {MILTON WAS A FARMING COMMUNITY AND MOST OF THE FIELDS WERE SOWN WITH GRASS TO FEED THE NUMEROUS COWS OWNED BY EIGHT FARMERS.TODAY THERE ARE MANY HOUSES,MANY LANES,AND ROADS BUT NO COWS BECAUSE MOST OF THE FARMS ARE USED FOR CROPS.THE RESIDENTIAL SURVEY SHOWS THAT THERE ARE ONE HUNDRED & FIFTY THREE DETACHED HOUSES,TWO HUN- DRED & NINETY SIX SEMIDETACHED, FOUR TERRACED HOUSES,SIXTY SIX BUNGALOWS,NINTY SIX FLATS,SEVEN SHOPS, FOUR PUBLIC HOUSES AND FIVE CARAVANS. {THE GHOST OF MILTON:}PEOPLE SAY THERE IS A GHOST AT MILTON HALL AND THAT IT IS OF A COACH WITH HORSES PULLING IT.IT DRAWS UP OUTSIDE THE HALL WHERE A LADY GETS OUT AND ENTERS THE HOUSE.NO ONE EVER SEES ANYTHING BUT HEARS THE NOISE OF THE HORSES HOOVES,THE COACH WHEELS AS THEY PULL UP OUTSIDE THE HOUSE,AND THE RUSTLING
